name: Unidentified_Son-tuul_Pride_member
content:
A human male member of the Son-tuul Pride criminal syndicate attended Crimson Dawn's auction of the carbonite-frozen smuggler Han Solo at the planet Jekara. He commanded the Son-tuul Pride War Cruiser Dark Syndicate, situated above the planet during the proceedings of the auction. When the rebel pilot Luke Skywalker arrived above Jekara in his X-wing starfighter, the Super Star Destroyer Executor deployed TIE fighters to pursue him. Skywalker, knowing that the criminals attending would take any excuse to fight the Galactic Empire, flew his X-wing near the Dark Syndicate, which sustained damage from the Imperial starfighters. In retaliation, the Son-tuul Pride member deployed vessels to attack the TIEs. The attack provided Skywalker with an opportunity to escape, but the Executor subsequently fired upon the Dark Syndicate, destroying the cruiser.
Though unidentified, the Son-tuul Pride member appeared in the sixteenth issue of the comic series Star Wars, written by Charles Soule, illustrated by Ramon Rosanas, and published by Marvel Comics on August 18, 2021. The individual's appearance is based on Declan Mulholland, who originally portrayed Jabba the Hutt in the 1977 film Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope, in a scene that was cut.
